text: Donald Fitzherbert Campbell (23 August 1886 – 24 September 1933) was an Anglican priest in the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries.'CAMPBELL, Ven. Donald Fitzherbert', Who Was Who, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 1920–2015; online edn, Oxford University Press, 2014 ; online edn, April 2014 accessed 20 March 2015 Campbell was educated at Charterhouse and New College, Oxford and ordained in 1910.Crockford's Clerical Directory London, OUP, 1908 After curacies in Liverpool and Hove he was Vicar of Vicar of Carlton Hill, Portslade and Preston. He succeeded his father as Archdeacon of Carlisle in 1930 but was killed in a motor accident three years later.Archdeacon of Carlisle Killed. The Times (London, England), Monday, 25 September 1933; pg. 12; Issue 46558 ==Notes== Category:1886 births Category:1930 deaths Category:People educated at Charterhouse School Category:Alumni of New College, Oxford Category:Archdeacons of Carlisle
title: Donald Campbell (priest)
